benchmark_details.name: DebateBench
benchmark_details.overview: DebateBench is a novel dataset consisting of transcripts and metadata from competitive British Parliamentary debates evaluated on their ability to engage in argumentation, deliberation, and alignment with human experts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a challenging benchmark for evaluating modern large language models on their reasoning capabilities in long-context argumentation.

data.source: Transcripts of British Parliamentary debates from prestigious competitive debating tournaments.
data.annotation: Annotations include detailed speech-level scores and house rankings sourced from official adjudication data.

methodology.calculation: For ranking tasks, the absolute difference between predicted and ground truth rankings is computed.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE indicates better performance. A higher accuracy percentage in predicting speaker scores indicates closer alignment with human judges.
methodology.baseline_results: Preliminary evaluation shows LLMs struggle on DebateBench, with GPT o1, GPT-4o, and Claude Haiku showing considerable errors.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All speakers provided prior consent for the datasets used.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants gave consent for the use of their speeches in the dataset.
